Authors: Rajesh Jeewon, Dhanasekaran Vijaykrishna, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Fusoidispora aquatica: A new ascomycete from Hong Kong based
on morphology and phylogeny inferred from rDNA sequences
Abstract:
During a survey of freshwater ascomycetes in Hong Kong, an
interesting ascomycete with fusoid ascospores that had mucilaginous pads
at both apices was identified. The affinities of this taxon extend
between a wide range of unitunicate ascomycetes (viz.Â Annulatascaceae,
Magaporthaceae, Pleurotremaceae, Trichosphaeriaceae). In order to
evaluate its familial placement and generic relatedness with other known
ascomycetes, partial DNA sequences derived from the large subunit
ribosomal DNA (28S rDNA) were analyzed. Results from the phylogenetic
analyses indicate that the family Annulatascaceae is polyphyletic. The
unidentified taxon has close affinities with the Annulatascaceae and
Ophiostomataceae but does not belong in any existing genera. Thus a new
genus, Fusoidispora aquatica, is established to accommodate it.
